Combine several regimens into a single data.frame, which can be passed into luna::run_sim() as regimen argument.

Source: R/create_regimen.R
combine_regimens.Rd

Combine several regimens into a single data.frame, which can be passed into luna::run_sim() as regimen argument.

Usage

combine_regimens(...)

Arguments

...

each argument is a named regimen, that in itself is specified as a list containing multiple regimens, each created using create_regimen(). See examples.

Details

This allows both for combination of two or more phases, e.g. loading doses and maintenance phase in a single regimen. It also allows for specification of multiple separate regimens to simulate, e.g. a high-dose regimen and a low-dose regimen.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
regimens <- combine_regimens(
  "without_load" = list(
    create_regimen(
      dose = 500,
      interval = 12,
      n = 10,
      route = "oral"
    )
  ),
  "with_load" = list(
    create_regimen(
      dose = 2000,
      n = 1,
      interval = 12,
      route = "iv",
      t_inf = 1
    ),
    create_regimen(
      dose = 500,
      n = 5,
      interval = 24,
      route = "oral"
    )
 )
)
} # }
